instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00850 No Image On Internal Screen
threads.message: Hello. Got this board with coffee spill. Lots of coffee got inside the screen connector on screen side. The board turns on, generates external display but no internal display activity. I cannot tell if there's no image or no backlight, but I think it has no image. Where should I start? Already cleaned up the mess and replaced EDP cable and tried with known good display, but same result.

threads.title: 820-00850 No Image On Internal Screen
threads.message: Liquid damage on LCD connector damaged the CPU, so its most likely not fixable without replacing the CPU. You can check diode mode on EDP_INT_AUX_N to see if it is shorted. Most likely is, because that is the pin that is right next to the LCD backlight

threads.title: 820-00850 No Image On Internal Screen
threads.message:
This is a classic damage, which place the machine out of warranty.
Apple did the best (for its business) placing a data line next to 50V rail.

threads.title: 820-00850 No Image On Internal Screen
threads.message: Dead cpu even if it gives external video?

threads.title: 820-00850 No Image On Internal Screen
threads.message:
iGPU has different outputs for internal/external video.
The iGPU core is still good, but eDP output (for internal LCD) is damaged.
